alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 15 at 2:17PM MST until August 15 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MST/5 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON EAST OF HIGHWAY 180 JUST NORTH OF KENDRICK PARK IN COCONINO COUNTY... At 214 PM MST /314 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated light rain continuing across the warned area, from 3 to 10 miles north of Kendrick Park and just east of Highway 180. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain fell earlier this afternoon. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Saddle Mountain, Red Mountain Trailhead. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Cedar Wash, Lava Wash, Needmore Wash and Deadman Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
